data.title: Dessert
data.text: My last review spoke of the main course.  Our most recent visit led to the discovery of a great dessert dish.  It's sticky rice with slices of mango.  Very simple dish, so it would seem, with a great test.  It's a delightful finishing touch to dinner.  We had to take it home since the main courses filled us up.

data.title: Unique Dining Experience
data.text: The Krung Thep Restaurant is a great place for an evening out.  Located in downtown Idaho Falls with an enjoyable atmosphere and very nice food service personnel.

data.title: First time here, definitely not last!
data.text: Excellent food. Friendly prompt service. Spice level to order and was perfect. My husband enjoyed the chicken green curry and said it was he ever had. I had spicy eggplant with tofu. Wonderful unique flavors.

data.title: Very good Thai food
data.text:
I have heard about this place from family and read about it on Trip Advisor but never got around to trying this place out until today.  
Everything I tasted there was good. I wasn't sure if I would like their salad with peanut dressing, but it was delicious.

I also tried their orange chicken and it was cooked perfectly. I also tried their Yellow Curry and it was also delicious. 

If you are looking good Thai food in Idaho Falls you can't go wrong if you choose to go to Krung Thep's.

data.title: Best Thai Resturant
data.text: This is the best Thai Restaurant in Idaho Falls.  The food is excellent and the portions are big enough to share.  On occasion they have a hard time maintaining a consistent spice level sometime yesterday's 1 tastes more like today's 3.  The ambiance was a little stuffy but they seem to be working on updating it and adding new things to the menu.  Overall a great restaurant I recommend it.

data.title: Pretty Good Thai Food
data.text: I'm no expert on Thai cuisine but this restaurant serves Thai that is better than most I've had in much larger cities.

data.title: Great food-great service
data.text: We went to this restaurant for the first time tonight, as a friend had recommended we try it. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We split the sweet & sour chicken and the garlic pepper beef. The sweet and sour was our favorite. We also ordered shrimp rolls for an appetizer and they were delish! Watch the spice rating on your entree. We had spice level #2 and wouldn't have wanted to get any hotter. We will definitely go back.

data.title: Exceptional thai with style
data.text: Exceptional service, cute dining room, fair prices and huge portion. Wife and I split the mixed vegetables with shrimp. Choose your own spice level. Server was accommodating and brought a water pitcher for us at the table. Very good choice for Thai . They also have a wide selection of entree choices as well as a sushi menu!

data.title: Best thai around
data.text: I love thai food and this is cooked to order and VERY good. Come have some! You will not regret it for a moment

data.title: Great Thai food for a good value
data.text: There are really only two Thai places in town.  I'd rate them both the same.  I think the portion sizes are better at Krung Thep and love the Pad Thai.

data.title: Have eaten at Krung Thep several times, plus ordered take-out.
data.text: The ambience is simple, but the food is very good.   The cook, and most of the wait crew, are actually Thai.    Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Good food, mediocre service
data.text: Went for a group dinner. Sushi chef would make sushi ring a bell to notify staff that is was ready and then no one would bring it to the table.  We went and got it ourselves eventually.  The rest of the food was cooked fast and was delicious. The servers just weren't very friendly.

data.title: Best Thai food in Idaho Falls
data.text: Very good Thai food, also very good sushi. I like all the curries, and always start my meal with their fabulous fresh spring rolls. In fact, I like their food so much that I'm trying to eat my way through their menu.

data.title: Great food for great price
data.text:
The menu has all variations of the thai cuisine. The food tastest authentic and freshly done. Only the spring rolls - as a part of the lunch menu were deep frozen. Also the service was friendly.
I would go there again

data.title: Idaho Falls Treasure
data.text: Out on a Saturday afternoon adventure we had a craving for Thai food.  This place was awesome! Located in the classic downtown area it was clean modern and relaxing. A large lunch special menu covering most types and styles. All the lunch selections come with a tasty small salad and small egg-roll.  We started with the fabulous  fresh spring roll.  There were 12 pieces on the platter and presented beautifully.  The peanut sauce was wonderful. I had chicken and peanut sauce over spinach, Phil had veggies, tofu in oyster sauce. Both dishes were first rate with generous portions.  Rice options was a nice touch. We couldn't finish and before we asked they offered to package to go.  Great folks from host to wait staff! We will be back next time we're in the area!

data.title: OBSESSED
data.text: Love love love this place . I literally crave their fresh spring rolls and pad Thai everyday ! I have a lot of issues with my stomach and I never regret a meal here because it's so incredibly fresh!

data.title: Really Good Thai Food
data.text: We went here for the first time, and I was shocked that the food was so good.  The service was good, they bring a picher of water to your table, which I really appreciate.  On a side note, they have awesome kids cups!   The food was plentiful, and delicious.  The sushi roll was good, and so were the dumplings.  We can't wait to go again and try someother dishes.  Don't miss this place, its the best Thai I've had in a long time.

data.title: Delicious find!
data.text:
Who'd have thought that we would find such a delicious place here. When we first mentioned that we were eating Thai, our Thai friend was dubious. "Here?" She said. "I don't think so..."

Boy was she wrong. She screamed with delight claiming the spicy fried rice was authentic. We had papaya salad, Tom yum khum and need with pepper & garlic. All were filling and delicious. 

I'd consider coming back. Even though I love 600 miles away. With a stop.

data.title: Amazing Thai food
data.text: My husband and I always love eating there! The food is great no matter what we get! I'm so glad that it has stayed in business.

data.title: Surprisingly Good Thai Food for a Small Town
data.text:
We were very pleasantly surprised by Krung Thep. I ordered the Kra Praw (ground pork with basil leaves) and substituted brown rice for white rice, and loved it. It was the most tasty Kra Praw I've had in a long, long time. My spouse ordered Pad Khee Mao (Drunken Noodles) and he liked it, and he is Thai.

The portions are big. We could not finish all our food. 

On the spiciness scale I ordered a 3 out of 5, and it was hot to my tastebuds, but comfortable for me. Note: 3 out of 5 is quite spicy - it is not medium; it is hot and has some bite. If you don't like hot, you should do a 1.

The service was proficient and efficient, but nothing exceptional.

The restaurant is large and there is not a lot of Thai interior furnishings. But I think you come here for the food, not the atmosphere.

We would definitely go back here next time in town, and if Krung Thep were in Atlanta (our home town), we would be regulars.
